page.title: 14Brackley & Evenley housing
page.content: We talked to an estate agent in the town about housing in our area. On the whole she dealt with more houses in the village of Evenley than in Brackley and the former are generally more expensive than the latter. That is to say that the same sized house would cost more in Evenley than in Brackley (see "Brackley Estate Agent" - page 13). The oldest house in Evenly is called "The Manor House" and it dates from the sixteenth century. The oldest house in Brackley is to be found on Buckingham Road. It is one of Brackley's four thatched houses. Not many houses were built in Brackley between 1900 and 1960. This is because there was hardly any new industry appearing at the time. However there have been many houses built during the last twenty-five years.
